entry.title: Counting to 20 in French with a 2 year old - French Numbers

media:group.media:title: Counting to 20 in French with a 2 year old - French Numbers
media:group.media:description:
This is a spontaneous home video which wasn't originally meant for YouTube, but as little miss is learning her French numbers, I thought you might enjoy it. I've found this advent calendar particularly useful to reinforce her learning, as we've been counting the stockings every day, sometimes in French sometimes in English, to see which one we were allowed to open that day! We're actually slightly ahead as we're off to France before the 24th (Fingers crossed this actually goes to plan!), so I let her start the calendar at the end of November. Only mentioning as some of you may notice we counted to 21, yet it's not the 21st of December yet! üòÖ
Have a lovely Christmas! Joyeux No√´l √† tous !

entry.title: 7 French Expressions To Make POLITE REQUESTS - Conversational French

media:group.media:title: 7 French Expressions To Make POLITE REQUESTS - Conversational French
French Alphabet + 26 Words - Pronunciation Lesson
media:group.media:description:
French alphabet pronunciation lesson. You'll find learning the French alphabet particularly useful should you ever need to spell your name, your address or any other word to a French speaking person. If you're a beginner and are not yet familiar with French pronunciation, knowing your French ABC's will also help you get an idea of how French words are pronounced.
In this French alphabet lesson, I first recite the alphabet, then go over it again introducing a French word starting with each letter of the alphabet in turn and explaining the pronunciation of some of those words, to help you even further with your French pronunciation.
Hope you find this lesson useful! üôÇ
